org.mitre.provenance.capture.linux

Class PROCtor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mitre.provenance.capture.linux.PROCtor

  • public class PROCtor
extends Object
    This class is an operating system monitoring class for UNIX-based operating systems which support the proc filesystem. For more information about procfs, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Procfs

    Basically, this polls available OS information about processes that are running, and then saves that information as provenance. The OS will tell us for example which process IDs (PIDs) have which files open for read and write, and what the command line is of the application that executed. r

    We have to apply a few basic fingerprinting techniques to avoid logging duplicates.

    This code could doubtless see many improvements, but it's a basic proof of concept for how to collect provenance in real systems. For many users, this kind of provenance would be seen as too granular, but it can produce some very interesting findings; in particular, because we use content-bound identifiers on everything that we encounter, this can establish linkages between different processes that read and use the same files.

    A major weakness of this capture approach is that you can never know when in the process lifecycle to scan a particular PID. Which assets the process is using vary dramatically (particularly for long-lived processes) depending on when you hit it in the lifecycle. Improvements should focus around appending in subsequent polls.

    Author:
    moxious

      • getIDForFile

        protected String getIDForFile(File f)
                       throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                              IOException
        Computes a special identifier for files based on their path and when they were last modified. This is not a content-bound identifier, but can be used in case a duplicate file has been seen on the same system.
        Parameters:
        f - the file to use
        Returns:
        a string identifier
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException
        IOException

      • createOrRetrieveInvocation

        public PLUSInvocation createOrRetrieveInvocation(File procPID)
                                          throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                 IOException
        Get or create a new PLUSInvocation on the basis of a proc PID file, e.g. /proc/56 (pid 56) Returns null for insufficient permissions, or when you shouldn't log a particular pid. (For example, this program will not log its own run)
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException
        IOException

      • createOnlyIfNew

        public PLUSObject createOnlyIfNew(File f)
                           throws PROCtor.ExistsException,
                                  NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                  IOException
        Create a PLUSObject corresponding to a given file, only if that file is new. Note that throwing an ExistsException is not an error condition, to signal to the caller that provenance already exists.
        Parameters:
        f - the file to inspect.
        Returns:
        a PLUSObject if it is new.
        Throws:
        PROCtor.ExistsException - if provenance already exists for that object, this will be thrown.
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - on error
        IOException - on error.

      • makeCLIOptions

        public static void usage()

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws Exception
        If provided with arguments, the program processes only those PIDs. If given no arguments, it starts in polling mode.
        Throws:
        Exception
